intro: Schmidelia integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its simple, entire leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Schmidelia integrifolia is a perennial herb that is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
